sen.j: 大社（たいしゃ）とは大きな神社、または平安時代初期の延喜式神名帳に式内大社として列格される492の神社、または～大社と名乗る神社のこと。
sen.e: Taisha are large jinja (Shinto shrines), one of the 492 jinja categorized as such in the early Heian period text Jimmyocho (the list of deities) of Engishiki (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), or those jinja that have adopted the suffix.
sen.cmt: ・Jimmyocho (the list of deities) of Engishiki (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers): http://nipponkichi.jp/article_list.do;jsessionid=F9E054435FBB0A45DF9111A000E85023?kwd=804&ml_lang=en
sen.e: Taisha are large jinja (Shinto shrines), or one of the 492 jinja categorized as Shikinai Taisha in the early Heian period text Jimmyocho (the list of deities) of Engishiki (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), or those jinja that have adopted the suffix 'taisha'.
sen.cmt: 原文の"Category"を削除。orを補足。Shikinai Taishaを補足。'taisha'を補足。
sen.e: Taisha are large jinja (Shinto shrines), or one of the 492 jinja categorized as Shikinai Taisha in the early Heian period text Jimmyocho (the list of deities) of Engishiki (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), or those jinja that have adopted the suffix taisha.

sen.j: かつては単に大社（おおやしろ）といえば一般的には出雲大社（島根県出雲市）のことを指す。
sen.e: It was once the case that the characters of the word 'Taisha', pronounced 'Oyashiro', referred specifically to Izumo Taisha Shrine (Izumo City, Shimane Prefecture).
It was once the case that the characters of the word 'Taisha', pronounced 'Oyashiro', referred specifically to Izumo Taisha Shrine (Izumo City, Shimane Prefecture).
It was once the case that the characters of the word 'Taisha,' pronounced 'Oyashiro,' referred specifically to Izumo Taisha Shrine (Izumo City, Shimane Prefecture).

sen.j: 戦後、旧官幣大社や旧国幣大社など大社格の神社で大社を名乗ったところが多い。
sen.e: After the second world war, a large number of old Kanpei Taisha (Great Imperial Shrines) and Kokuhei Taisha (Great National Shrines) changed their titles to simply 'Taisha'.
After the second world war, a large number of old Kanpei Taisha (Great Imperial Shrines) and Kokuhei Taisha (Great National Shrines) changed their titles to simply 'Taisha'.
After the second world war, a large number of old Kampei Taisha (Great Imperial Shrines) and Kokuhei Taisha (Great National Shrines) changed their titles to simply Taisha.
sen.cmt: Kanpei→Kampei 用語リストに合わせる、ヘボン式原文に「」のない' 'を削除

sen.e: Examples are given below.
Examples are given below.
Examples are given below.

sen.j: （注1）「旧神社名」とは、近代社格制度下における神社名
sen.e: Note 1: 'Former Shrine Name' is the name by which the shrine was known under the integrated system of shrine ranks.
Note 1: 'Former Shrine Name' is the name by which the shrine was known under the integrated system of shrine ranks.
Note 1: 'Former Shrine Name' is the name by which the shrine was known under the integrated system of shrine ranks.

sen.j: （注2）「所在地」は現在の地名で表記
sen.e: Note 2: 'Location' gives the modern place name.
Note 2: 'Location' gives the modern place name.
Note 2: 'Location' gives the modern place name.

sen.j: 現在表記未定（両神社とも旧官幣大社）
sen.e: Modern denotation undetermined (both former Kampei Taisha)

sen.j: 氷川神社 - （埼玉県さいたま市大宮区） 授与品袋には氷川大社の表記
sen.e: Hikawa-jinja Shrine (Omiya Ward, Saitama City): Bags containing things bought from the shrine give the name 'Hikawa Taisha'.
Hikawa-jinja Shrine (Omiya Ward, Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture): Bags containing things bought from the shrine give the name 'Hikawa Taisha'.
Hikawa-jinja Shrine (Omiya Ward, Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture): Bags containing things bought from the shrine give the name 'Hikawa Taisha.'
sen.cmt: 最後のピリオドを'内に移動

sen.j: 平野神社 - （京都府京都市北区 (京都市)） かつて鳥居の扁額に平野大社の表記があった
sen.e: Hirano-jinja Shrine (Kita Ward, Kyoto City): The sign on the torii previously read 'Hirano Taisha'.
